Karnes City, a small yet vibrant municipality located in Karnes County, Texas, is rich in history and community spirit. Understanding the local government structure is essential for residents and visitors alike.

City Council

Mayor Leroy T. Skloss
Mayor Pro-Tem, District #5 Jimmy D. Loya Sr.

Council Member, District #1 Raymond Robinson

Council Member, District #2 Helen Hernandez

Council Member, District #3 Lesley Lewallen

Council Member, District #4 Donald Dziuk

City Manager

The City Manager (CM) position was created by Ordinance and is appointed by the City Council. The CM functions as the chief administrative officer of the city and serves at the pleasure of the City Council. The CM works closely with the Mayor and City Council by identifying priorities, by providing timely and accurate reports and information, and by making recommendations on current and future issues. The CM, with emphasis on community, service, and fiscal prudence, is responsible for achievement of goals, implementation of policies, enforcement of regulations and ordinances, effective operation of all City departments, and satisfactory delivery of all municipal services as directed by the Mayor and City Council. The CM, along with Senior Management Staff, is responsible for professional leadership and direction for the day-to-day operations of Karnes City…”the Epicenter of the Eagle Ford”.

Veronica Butler

City Secretary

The City Secretary is responsible for maintaining the official records of the City of Karnes City, posting all official notices, preparing agendas and supporting materials, recording the minutes of the City Council meetings, and assisting City Council as needed. This position also serves as the City Elections Officer, and Records Management Officer.

City Council minutes are located under the “Public Records” tab. Other City documents may be obtained or viewed by submitting a request for public-information form to the City Secretary’s Office. The request must be in writing and signed by the requestor; however, you may submit the request in any written form.

Requests for Public Information are filled within 10 working days. If records cannot be furnished within 10 working days, the requestor is notified by the City Secretary as to when such records will be available.

The City Secretary’s Office coordinates the posting of agendas and minutes for all other Municipal Boards, Commissions, and Committees, and the Office accepts applications from those wishing to serve on Committees. Please contact the office of the City Secretary at 830-780-3422 if you are interested in serving on a board.

NOTICE OF SEALED BID OPENING FOR SALE OF REAL PROPERTY The City of Karnes City, Texas (the “City”) is accepting sealed bids for the purchase of the following real property (the “Property”) as described in this Notice of Sealed Bid Opening: The Property commonly known as 211 E. Calvert, Karnes City, Texas 78118, being legally described as consisting of approximately 0.0670 acres of land, KARNES CITY COMMON WALL, BLK 20, LOT 16, CITY OF KARNES CITY, KARNES COUNTY, TEXAS. The Property contains an existing structure that includes approximately 2,580 sq. ft. of rentable office space, as well as an additional 1, 152 sq. ft. of unfinished space on the second story. It is the intention of the City to sell the Property based on the best value bid that is submitted. If, in the judgment of the City Council, none of the bids submitted represent the fair value of the Property, the City reserves the right to reject any and all bids. Should any bid be accepted, payment shall be made by earnest money deposit, subject to closing, and shall be deposited with the City or designated escrow agent by cashier’s check or money order payable to “City of Karnes City, Texas” within ten days of the award notice. RECOMMENDED MINIMUM BID: $230,000.00 The property will be sold “as is” with no warranties or representations as to suitability for any particular use. Conveyance of the property will be by special warranty deed. Bids shall be delivered in writing, signed by the bidder or an authorized representative, and enclosed in a sealed envelope to the City of Karnes City, C/O Veronica Butler, City Manager, 1007 N. Hwy 123, Karnes City, Texas 78118. All bids shall be plainly marked “SEALED BID TO PURCHASE REAL PROPERTY.” Bids must be received before 4:30 p.m. on July 10, 2025, and any bid received after that time will not be considered. City Council will open, read, and tabulate the bids at 6:00 p.m. on July 22, 2025, at City Hall, 1007 N. HWY 123, City of Karnes City. Bidders may contact Veronica Butler, City Manager, at 830-780-3422 for clarifications and questions
